item.title: Alaina add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Robert Burns
item.description: "Wee, sleekit, cowrin, tim'rous beastie, O, what a panic's in thy breastie! " -- Robert Burns

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Mary Dugger
item.description: "[Looking like a straight girl] means wearing clothes that seek and destroy comfort. These are garments designed by gay men to attract heterosexual men. The straight girl is simply the hanger for an inside joke." -- Mary Dugger

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Of my conception I know only what you know of yours. It occurred in darkness and I was unconsenting... By some bleak alchemy what had been mere unbeing becomes death when life is mingled with it." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I’ve met God across his long walnut desk with his diplomas hanging on the wall behind him, and God asks me, “Why?” Why did I cause so much pain? Didn’t I realize that each of us is a sacred, unique snowflake of special unique specialness? Can’t I see how we’re all manifestations of love? I look at God behind his desk, taking notes on a pad, but God’s got this all wrong. We are not special. We are not crap or trash, either. We just are. We just are, and what happens just happens. And God says, “No, that’s not right.” Yeah. Well. Whatever. You can’t teach God anything." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Thomas More
item.description: "[how can anyone] be silly enough to think himself better than other people, because his clothes are made of finer woolen thread than theirs. After all, those fine clothes were once worn by a sheep, and they never turned it into anything better than a sheep." -- Thomas More

item.title: Alaina add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "He is my dog, Toto," answered Dorothy. "Is he made of tin, or stuffed?" asked the Lion. "Neither. He's a-- a-- a meat dog," said the girl." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "...Emma still had a joyless look, and, habitually, at the corners of her mouth, she had that tightness that crumples the faces of old maids and bankrupts." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "Jerome was sliding and climbing on top of me and it felt like it had the night before, like a crushing weight. So do boys and men announce their intentions. They cover you like a sarcophagus lid. And call it love." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Alaina add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "She wore a gown the color of storms, shadows, and rain and a necklace of broken promises and regrets." -- Susanna Clarke
